org.bitcoinj.protocols.channels

Class PaymentChannelV2ClientState

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bitcoinj.protocols.channels.PaymentChannelClientState
      • org.bitcoinj.protocols.channels.PaymentChannelV2ClientState

  • public class PaymentChannelV2ClientState
extends PaymentChannelClientState
    Version 2 of the payment channel state machine - uses CLTV opcode transactions instead of multisig transactions.

      • initiate

        public void initiate(@Nullable
                     org.spongycastle.crypto.params.KeyParameter userKey)
              throws ValueOutOfRangeException,
                     InsufficientMoneyException
        Description copied from class: PaymentChannelClientState
        Creates the initial multisig contract and incomplete refund transaction which can be requested at the appropriate time using PaymentChannelV1ClientState.getIncompleteRefundTransaction() and PaymentChannelV1ClientState.getContract(). The way the contract is crafted can be adjusted by overriding PaymentChannelV1ClientState#editContractSendRequest(org.bitcoinj.wallet.Wallet.SendRequest). By default unconfirmed coins are allowed to be used, as for micropayments the risk should be relatively low.
        Specified by:
        initiate in class PaymentChannelClientState
        Parameters:
        userKey - Key derived from a user password, needed for any signing when the wallet is encrypted. The wallet KeyCrypter is assumed.
        Throws:
        ValueOutOfRangeException - if the value being used is too small to be accepted by the network
        InsufficientMoneyException - if the wallet doesn't contain enough balance to initiate

      • getRefundTxFees

        public Coin getRefundTxFees()
        Description copied from class: PaymentChannelClientState
        Returns the fees that will be paid if the refund transaction has to be claimed because the server failed to settle the channel properly. May only be called after PaymentChannelClientState.initiate()
        Specified by:
